name: Town Bread
description: Simple bread loaf baked locally in town.

name: Peasant's Stew
description: A simple meat-and-vegetable stew, mostly potatoes.

name: Hunter's Broth
description: Hearty stew with fresh game and wild roots.

name: Golden Elk Ragu
description: A slow-roasted elk stew with fire-charred onions and aged stock.

name: Crumbly Sugar Biscuit
description: Dry and overly sweet, but beloved by children.

name: Autumn Berry Tart
description: A golden crust filled with local berries and honey glaze.

name: Royal Custard Crown
description: A multilayered cream dessert served with candied petals.

name: Firestick Jerky
description: Chewy meat sticks laced with hot peppers.

name: Dragonspice Chili
description: A fiery mix of beans, meat, and wildfire sauce.

name: Hellboar Ribs
description: Char-grilled ribs smothered in molten chili glaze.

name: Stoneground Flatbread
description: Dense flatbread made with coarse flour and forest grains.

name: Forager's Pie
description: A warm pie stuffed with mushrooms and root vegetables.

name: Druid's Table
description: Forest greens, wild grains, and enchanted truffle oil.

name: Pickled Bits Plate
description: A mix of sharp pickled roots and eggs.

name: Sour Apple Pork
description: Grilled pork with tangy green apple glaze.

name: Vinegar-Cured Quail
description: Delicately cured quail with a reduction of wine vinegar.

name: Boar Haunch Stew
description: A muddy stew of wild boar haunch, cave millet, and coldroot. Common fare for workers in Crooked Crossing.

name: Stonecap Fungi Bake
description: Sliced stonecap mushrooms roasted with goatcurd and whisperbloom, then baked in roughbarley crust. A staple in Glimmerfen.

name: Duskhorn Royale
description: Succulent duskhorn steak and hearthleaf, stewed with thorn spice and topped with goldpetal nectar. Served at noble tables in Hollowmere.

name: Crumbleberry Scone
description: Dry but satisfying scones, sweetened with glimmer sugar and filled with blood plum compote. Favored by minersâ€™ children.

name: Spark Apple Tart
description: Golden tart of spark apple slices and sap honey, dusted with moonglow petal. A festival treat in Tranquil Rise.

name: Royal Nectar Trifle
description: A layered confection of goldpetal nectar, churned cream, and twilight fig. Reserved for feasts in Moondrop Cliff.

name: Ashpepper Crumble
description: Crispy bread crumbs laced with ashpepper and fire lizard tail, baked for heat lovers of Suncleft Dunes.

name: Embervale Hotpot
description: Molten pepper and basilisk fat simmered with flameberry and boar, eaten by caravan guards in Embervale.

name: Inferno Chili
description: Legendary stew of duskhorn steak, molten pepper, thorn spice, and embershard flake, said to awaken dragons.

name: Mudroot Mash
description: Boiled stonebeet, mudroot, and goatcurd. Heavy, plain, and filling for hungry travelers.

name: Forager's Loaf
description: Wild cave millet and mellowleaf, baked together with forest mushrooms from Gloamhollow Basin.

name: Elder's Root Supper
description: Coldroot, cragvine, and spiral clam meat slow-cooked in goatcurd, dusted with cracked myrrh.

name: Briarberry Pie
description: Pie of blood plum and ghost melon with a vinegar tang, a staple in Shatterspire.

name: Frostmilk Quiche
description: A tart quiche of frostberry and frostmilk, flavored with sunroot and mellowleaf.

name: Vinegar Roast Quail
description: Wild quail marinated in ghost melon juice, finished with a glaze of cave syrup and spark apple.

name: Bitter Squash Fritters
description: Fried patties of grated bitter squash and dryspike bean, favored in Cinderfen Oasis.

name: Twilight Fig Toss
description: Roasted twilight fig and gravedust shard, tossed with wisp essence and mellowleaf.

name: Cracked Myrrh Cakes
description: Delicate cakes soaked in cracked myrrh syrup, with sunroot for a fragrant aftertaste.

name: Stormsalt Flatbread
description: Flatbread of roughbarley and stormsalt, chewy and filling, keeps well for journeys.

name: Red Lantern Crab
description: Stir-fried spiral clam meat, red lantern pod, and skywater droplet, a Cranewatch Pier delicacy.

name: Crystal Cavern Cure
description: A brined blend of cave millet, embershard flake, and glowmint. Eaten after hard labor in the mines.

name: Smoked Barley Cakes
description: Dense cakes made from smoked barley and churned cream. A staple in Skyroot Steppe.

name: Emberbluff Brisket
description: Brisket of wild game, slow-cooked with fire lizard tail and smoked cheese, finished over ashen coals.

name: Molten Spice Ribs
description: Charred hellboar ribs glazed with thorn spice and embershard flake, a feast for the brave.

name: Churned Cream Porridge
description: A simple, filling porridge of churned cream, cloud yam, and sap honey.

name: Silvershine Souffle
description: Soft souffle whipped from goatcurd, glimmer sugar, and silvercap for a shimmering finish.

name: Royal Cream Crown
description: Decadent tower of churned cream, topped with moonglow petals and dusted with goldpetal nectar.

name: Wildberry Crumble
description: Roasted berries from Thorncage Dell, sweetened with sap honey and baked into a crumbly crust.

name: Ghost Melon Galette
description: Thin, sweet galette made with ghost melon and mellowleaf, light as air from Echoweald.

name: Sunroot Orchard Tart
description: A golden tart of sunroot, spark apple, and cave syrup. Glazed for festivals in Tranquil Rise.

name: Roughbarley Flatbread
description: Coarse flatbread made with roughbarley and windwheat, dry but nourishing.

name: Cave Millet Crackers
description: Crispy crackers baked from cave millet, dusted with cracked myrrh for a mineral tang.

name: Wisp Bread
description: An airy bread made with wisp essence and goldpetal nectar. So light, it nearly floats.

name: Glowmint Salad
description: Fresh glowmint, hearthleaf, and mellowleaf tossed with a hint of vinegary pickled bits.

name: Herbal Stock Risotto
description: Creamy risotto cooked in herbal stock and topped with skywater droplet and cragvine.

name: Moonglow Garden Soup
description: A glowing soup of moonglow petal, sunroot, and mellowleaf, traditionally made on moonless nights.
